SpellLevel.Name: Cantrips
SpellLevel.Description: Level one spells are commonly called cantrips, they are the weakest spells a spellcaster can master.

SpellLevel.Name: Minor
SpellLevel.Description: Level two spells are minor spells that are slightly more powerful than the cantrips the newest spellcasters start out with.

SpellLevel.Name: Apprentice
SpellLevel.Description: Level three spells are commonly called apprentice level spells. They show the spellcaster is progressing in prowess.

SpellLevel.Name: Journeyman
SpellLevel.Description: Level four spells are commonly called journeyman level spells. These are the most powerful spells cast by the average member of the spellcasting class.

SpellLevel.Name: Expert
SpellLevel.Description: Experts in a spellcasting class can cast these powerful spells.

SpellLevel.Name: Master
SpellLevel.Description: Level six spells are available only to those who have truly mastered their profession.

SpellLevel.Name: Ancient
SpellLevel.Description: The most powerful spells available are those gleaned from the forbidden knowledge of the ancients.
